basics.name: Yoomin Lee
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: I work at the intersection of computer vision and applied ML, turning ideas into measurable improvements. My emphasis is on disciplined evaluation, robustness under shift, and deploying systems that stay reliable for real users.
Computer vision + applied ML; I care about measurable gains (quality, robustness) and dependable deployment to real users.

education.institution: State University of New York at Oswego

work.name: AIoT Group at Seoul National University
work.summary: Worked on Lens, a sensor-control system that optimizes image acquisition under domain shift. Designed evaluation on real-world datasets and drove targeted data collection to expose failure modes and improve robustness.
highlights: Contributed to the development of “Lens”, a novel sensor control system optimizing image acquisition for neural networks under domain shift conditions.
Designed evaluation protocols using real-world datasets (ImageNet-ES Natural), achieving significant performance gains in object recognition tasks.
Led diverse parameter-based dataset collection under strict deadlines, ensuring data diversity for robust model testing.

work.name: Multimodal AI Lab at Hanyang University
work.summary: Explored fine-grained visual recognition with multimodal priors (geography/language). Extended a CLIP/Transformer baseline to inject context and measured consistent gains across few-shot settings.
highlights: Relativity

work.name: COGA Robotics
work.summary: Worked on indoor person-following: fused LiDAR and RGB-D in ROS, optimized Deep SORT on Jetson, and profiled perception latency to meet real-time constraints.
highlights: Relativity

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: SNU Ambient AI Competition — 1st Prize
awards.summary: Built an on-device real-time blurring app (team of 4).

awards.title: DB GAPS Challenge — 2nd Place
awards.awarder: DB Kim Jun Ki Cultural Foundation
awards.summary: Designed automated investment strategy using financial & market data (team of 4).

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Lens: Sensor-Aware Image Acquisition under Shift
projects.summary: Prototype sensor control that adapts capture parameters to scene/domain shift to stabilize downstream model quality.
highlights: Evaluation on natural distribution shifts (real-world image sets)
Data collection protocol to expose failure modes
Quality tracking with regression-safe comparisons

projects.name: On-Device Real-Time Blurring (SNU Ambient AI 1st Prize)
projects.summary: Mobile pipeline for privacy-preserving video blurring with tight latency and power budgets.
highlights: Model/runtime trade-off exploration on device
Deterministic benchmarking harness (latency & quality)
Team execution from prototype to demo

projects.name: Few-Shot Fine-Grained Recognition with Context
projects.summary: Injected geographic/language priors into a CLIP-style baseline for fine-grained categories.
highlights: Context feature engineering and conditioning
Few-shot evaluation with stratified splits
Ablations + seeded reproducible runs

projects.name: Indoor Person-Following Stack (ROS + Jetson)
projects.summary: Fused LiDAR and RGB-D to stabilize tracking in cluttered indoor environments.
highlights: ID-switch analysis & latency budget profiling
Recovery behaviors validated in field tests

projects.name: On-device Privacy Blur (Competition Project)
projects.summary: Prototype that performs real-time blurring on-device with latency and quality constraints; focused on measurement discipline and robust edge behavior.
highlights: Defined latency/quality budget and held the system to it
Delivered repeatable test runs and reports

projects.name: OLAP vs. OLTP DBMS Analysis: DuckDB vs. PostgreSQL
projects.summary: System-level comparison of columnar DuckDB and row-store PostgreSQL for analytical vs. transactional patterns.
highlights: Benchmarked scan/buffer/file-format paths with C++ micro-workloads
Sequential-query performance and trade-off analysis for analytics use cases
Actionable guidance for pipeline DBMS selection

projects.name: Classifying Similar Furniture
projects.summary: End-to-end pipeline for visually similar furniture categories with custom image assets.
highlights: Self-created dataset via modeling/rendering; rigorous splits
TensorFlow baseline → model refinements with measurable gains

projects.name: Zoning Generation Program for Ideal Floor Plan
projects.summary: Algorithmic zoning assistant for early-stage floor-plan design (Processing).
highlights: Encoded architectural constraints into search/heuristics
Brought interior-design domain knowledge into computational tooling

projects.name: “Haenggarae” Social-Value Platform Deployment
projects.summary: Campus-scale rollout of a blockchain-based app incentivizing eco-friendly behaviors.
highlights: Localization and QR/NFC behavior tracking for 10+ activities
Early user-engagement strategies with industry partner
